text:
Hi everyone I am Niharika and welcome back.
Well in today's lesson we are gonna look at

some royal phrases. Now what's royal? Royal
is having a status of a King or Queen or something

related to royal power. In English we have
some royal phrases for common people like

us, isn't that great! And they are really
nice and simple to use. So let's learn what
are these phrases.

Very first one we have is Drama Queen. Drama
queen is used especially for a woman who is

extremely melodramatic. Like for a situation
or for an event the way this woman would react

will be in a very exaggerated and melodramatic
way. Like for example, a friend of mine lost

her wallet. And this another friend of mine
was like "Oh no, Really!! Oh that's awful"

. Now that's quite and exaggerated reaction,
right? SO she is such a drama queen. SO a

woman who reacts in an over dramatic way or
in a very melodramatic manner, she is a drama

queen. So there are so many women who do that,
they love all the drama in their lives. SO

that's a perfect phrase to use for such women.
So someone who would act 'Oh no that's horrible'
or 'that's awful' so they are way too melodramatic.

The second one that I have for you is Queen
bee. Well, have you watched the movie Mean

Girls? Now, Mean girls if you have seen the
movie you would realize what I am talking

about. Queen bee is again used for a woman
who tries to be the centre of attraction.

She thinks that she is the best in a group.
Like it is a group of ten girls and if one

of the girl is a queen bee it means that she
likes things to be revolved around her. She

likes to be the centre of attraction. She
likes to be perfect, well kind of she thinks

she is perfect in the group so she is the
queen bee of that group. So a girl who thinks,

she's the best. Okay, so she is the queen
bee.

The third phrase that I have for you is Prince
Charming, well I am still waiting for my Prince

Charming. So, who is that prince charming?
Well, the guy in the fairy tales, yes! Prince

charming is used for a man who is just perfect,
who is very attractive, very kind and who

would be a perfect soul mate. A man of a woman's
dreams. OK, so he is a prince charming. Where

is your prince charming? You still dreaming
about him? So prince charming is a perfect

phrase for a very attractive man and a very
kind ,very polite and a very rich man. OK,so
that's Prince charming for you.

The next one - Live like a king . Have you
heard that before? I am sure you have, so

what exactly does this phrase really mean?
Live like a king it means to live luxuriously.

When someone is living a very comfortable,
a very luxurious life, he lives like a king.

Well of course, if you have read stories about
kings and queens of course about the royals,

they had a very luxurious life. They had servants,
they had the best of things in their palace.

So they of course lived like a king. If you
also have a very comfortable, very rich and

luxurious life then you live like a king.
A friend of mine, he won a lottery and since

then he is been living like a king. Because
he has so much money, drinks champagne, he

drives a Ferrari and now he is living like
a king. So, to live like a king is ..a luxurious
life.

The next phrase that I have for you is King's
ransom. King's ransom is a phrase used for

huge money, like a fortune. Now imagine, in
olden days the king was held for ransom, can

you imagine the amount of money that someone
would have to pay to get the king back. Well

yes, so king's ransom is a perfect phrase
for fortune, for something that cost's way

too much..Millions..Billions.. For Example
- This house is beautiful, I am sure it costs

a king's fortune. SO that means the house
is so beautiful that I am sure it is a very

expensive one. I would like to buy a watch
but I really don't want to pay king's ransom.

SO it means I don't wanna buy a very expensive
watch where I have to pay too much of money.

So I don't want that kind of a watch. So that's
how you can use this phrase. Got that?

And then the last royal phrase that I have
for you is Fit for a King. Now, when do you

use that? Now fit for a king is little similar
to live like a king. Fit for a king is you

know something that is really expensive and
that's really nice and very luxurious. For

example I went for a vacation last month and
my hotel room was just fit for a king, it

means my hotel room was really nice. It was
a very luxurious stay that i had. So, fit

for a king it means something which is really
nice and luxurious. Ok! so that's how you

can use it. Look at your car, it's just fit
for a king. so probably you have bought this

expensive car and you know it fits for a king,
its very luxurious and it's very classy and
nice.

So these are the six royal phrases that you
can use in your daily conversation, they are

simple and they fun to use, so use them. I
will back with a new lesson till then take care
